required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Laboratory Study of Cannabidiol on the Effects of Smoked Marijuana
clinical_study.official_title: Laboratory Study of the Influence of Oral Cannabidiol on the Subjective, Reinforcing and Cardiovascular Effects of Smoked Marijuana

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to assess the effects of oral cannabidiol (CBD; 0, 200, 400, 800 mg) on smoked marijuana's (0, 5.6% THC) subjective, reinforcing, cognitive, and cardiovascular effects. This experiment is expected to reveal CBD's intrinsic effects when combined with placebo marijuana, as well as its ability to modulate the behavioral effects of active marijuana.

detailed_description.textblock: Marijuana contains many chemicals called cannabinoids. The ingredient mainly responsible for marijuana's psychoactive effects is called THC (delta-9-tetrahydrocannabinol. Another cannabinoid in marijuana is cannabidiol. It is found in smaller quantities than THC. Cannabidiol is thought to interfere with the effects of THC. Therefore, synthetically produced cannabidiol is given to healthy marijuana users in this study to test its capability to reduce the high of THC and, thereby, help to relieve addiction to marijuana.

primary_outcome.time_frame: two hours before and after marijuana cigarette smoking
primary_outcome.description: Visual analog scale range 1 (not at all) - 100 (extremely) millimeters.

other_outcome.description: Participants rated how much they liked the effects of smoked marijuana using a visual analog scale 1-100 mm, 1=least, 100= most
Subjects rated how strong the effects of the cannabis were using a visual analog scale.

other_outcome.measure: Optional Additional Puffs of MJ Cigarette
other_outcome.time_frame: 150 to 250 minutes after first marijuana cigarette was smoked earlier in the day
other_outcome.description: Participants were allowed to choose to take or reject additional puffs of the same type of MJ cigarette they smoked earlier in the day. Counts of participants choosing to take additional puffs are reported.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Optional Puffs of MJ Cigarette Taken
other_outcome.time_frame: 150 to 160 minutes after first marijuana cigarette was smoked earlier in the day
other_outcome.description: Mean number of puffs taken by those participants who chose to take additional puffs.

other_outcome.time_frame: 120 minutes before and 150 minutes after marijuana cigarette smoking
other_outcome.description: Heart rate measured at 10 time points, 4 before and 6 after smoking cannabis.
Plasma concentrations of cannabidiol were measured at six time points after oral administration of four 200 mg capsules of CBD.

intervention.description: Each subject in the study was tested on eight days, each day receiving a different combination of active/inactive cannabis cigarettes plus 0, 200, 400 or 800 mg of CBD in random order. Cigarettes contained either 0.01 or 5.30% THC. At each visit, participants were given four gelatin capsules containing lactose and 0 or 200 mg of CBD in combinations to achieve scheduled dose level.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults between the ages of 18 and 50.
- Current marijuana use: Minimum of four times per week, 0.5 joints per occasion during the preceding 4 weeks.
- Able to perform study procedures
- Women practicing an effective form of birth control
Exclusion Criteria:
- Female subjects who are currently pregnant or breastfeeding.
- Current, repeated illicit drug use other than marijuana
- Presence of significant medical illness
- History of heart disease
- Request for drug treatment
- Current parole or probation
- Recent history of significant violent behavior
- Major psychiatric disorder

facility.name: University of Kentucky, Straus Behavioral Research Bldg., 515 Oldham Ct.
Marijuana Outpatient Lab 1051 Riverside Dr. Unit #120
Center for Drug and Alcohol Programs, Room 459 North, 67 President St.

clinical_study.keyword: reinforcement, good drug effect, high, mood, cannabidiol

group.title: Single Group
group.description: Each subject in the study will be tested on eight days, each day receiving a different combination of active/inactive marijuana cigarette plus 0, 200, 400 or 800 mg of cannabidiol A subset of study completers will be given 800 mg of cannabidiol on one additional study visit to measure plasma concentrations of cannabidiol for up to 360 minutes after ingestion

baseline.population: count - only those participants who completed all 8 visits (31)

group.title: Single Group
group.description: Each subject in the study will be tested on eight days, each day receiving a different combination of active/inactive marijuana cigarette plus 0, 200, 400 or 800 mg of cannabidiol A subset of study completers will be given 800 mg of cannabidiol on one additional study visit to measure plasma concentrations of cannabidiol for up to 360 minutes after ingestion

outcome.title: Plasma Concentration of CBD
outcome.description: Plasma concentrations of cannabidiol were measured at six time points after oral administration of four 200 mg capsules of CBD.
outcome.population: 8 participants volunteered to come to a ninth session for dosing with 800 mg CBD and donation of 7 blood samples.

group.title: Plasma CBD Concentrations
group.description: Eight of the 31 participants who completed the study came to a ninth session to receive 800 mg CBD and donate seven blood samples over six hours, one immediately before swallowing CBD capsules, and 6 throughout the next six hours. Plasma samples were analyzed through NIDA contract #NO1DA-14-7788 to David Moody, Ph.D.

measure.title: Plasma Concentration of CBD
measure.description: Plasma concentrations of cannabidiol were measured at six time points after oral administration of four 200 mg capsules of CBD.
measure.population: 8 participants volunteered to come to a ninth session for dosing with 800 mg CBD and donation of 7 blood samples.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events reported within 72 hours of each cannabidiol administration
reported_events.desc: Cannabis strength was collapsed for each cannabidiol dose level

group.title: Active MJ With 0 mg CBD
group.description: 31 subjects were tested with 0 mg CBD and an active marijuana cigarette.

group.title: Active MJ With 200 mg CBD
group.description: 31 subjects were tested with 200 mg CBD and an active marijuana cigarette.

group.title: Active MJ With 400 mg CBD
group.description: 31 subjects were tested with 400 mg CBD and an active marijuana cigarette.

group.title: Active MJ With 800 mg CBD
group.description: 31 subjects were tested with 800 mg CBD and an active MJ cigarette.

group.title: Inactive MJ With 0 mg CBD
group.description: 31 subjects were tested with 0 mg CBD and an inactive MJ cigarette.

group.title: Inactive MJ With 200 mg CBD
group.description: 31 subjects were tested with 0 mg CBD and an inactive MJ cigarette.

group.title: Inactive MJ With 400 mg CBD
group.description: 31 subjects were tested with 400 mg CBD and an inactive marijuana cigarette.

group.title: Inactive MJ With 800 mg CBD
group.description: 31 subjects were tested with 800 mg CBD and Inactive MJ cigarette. 8 of the 31 study completers were given 800 mg of cannabidiol on one additional study visit to measure plasma concentrations of cannabidiol for up to 360 minutes after ingestion. No MJ cigarette was smoked during this session. Adverse events reported during this session are included here.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
